WorkItem.ClosedComment: The fix should be visible in the upcoming release. Thanks!
WorkItem.Description:
(from: https://typescript.codeplex.com/discussions/472116)

I have declared class called ArrayConstructor (declared, so no implementation of methods.. ). ArrayConstructor implements interface Array (from lib.d.ts). I coppied all declaration of Array (from lib.d.ts) and pasted to ArrayConstructor.

Example is here (typescript playground): http://ow.ly/rw4UN

Why is there error with concat method?
WorkItem.Summary: Cannot implement interface Array from lib.d.ts (v0.9.5)

Comments.Message:
The link is damaged... here is link to the same code:
http://bit.do/eT9f

In case itâ€™s not clear from the original description, this problem did not exist in 0.9.1.1. It seems whatever prevents implementing Array also makes it impossible to cast from Array to another compatible interface because TypeScript insists that the two concats are incompatible.
